alert.note: Alert for Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 6:02PM EDT until July 09 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Rockingham. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 602 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Benaja Creek, Dan River, Carroll Creek, Belews Creek, Country Line Creek and Big Beaver Island Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eden... Reidsville... Wentworth... Mayodan... Madison... Monroeton... Bethany... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
